Text:
Create your own golden moments, only with London 2012 - The Official  Video
Game of the Olympic Games

Features

Go for Gold - Compete in over 35 events, including all the blue ribbon
events plus some all-new events to Olympic video games offering the
ultimate depth and variety
More ways to play - Compete in a wide range of challenges and game modes
including Olympic Games, Events Mode, Online Mode and Party Play.
Compete for Global Glory - Take the competition online with leader
boards tracking personal medal counts, and earn National Pride
points with each medal you win for your country - keep playing
and improve your nations standing
The Ultimate Olympic Games Experience - Get closer than ever to the
experience of the Olympic Games with reactive commentary,
super-realistic graphics and TV style presentation

For those with windows XP this game will not work. It will always say "The procedure entry point UnregisterPowerSettingNotification could not be located in the dynamic link library USER32.dll"

This is because the entry point UnregisterPowerSettingNotification is not in the USER32.dll for the windows xp. Its only in the USER32.dll for vista and windows 7. 

This game will not work with windows XP.

Those who have problems with the black screen and then disappear (cannot run the game), I had the same problem and figure out the solution myself. This is the steps what I did. I have Windows 7 professional 64bit and ASUS ATI 6970 DCII graphics card.

1. Update graphics card to its latest driver (I did mine via driver reviver) 
2. Turned user account control to NEVER NOTIFY ME.
3. Turn off the anti-virus 
3. Install the game
4. Run the game in compatible mode of Windows 95 or Windows 98/ME and select the check box of administrator.

This steps work for me, if it does not work try this if you have AMD Catalyst installed.

1. Install steam 
2. Register or login in your steam account
3. Select steam at top bar menu
4. Update AMD Catalyst driver

This work also plus you can run the game without compatible mode. (Well it did for me) The only problem that I have know is every time I reboot my pc, I must install the AMD update every time to avoid the black screen and then disappear problem.

I will post again if I have a figure out how to avoid this problem. 

Hope this work for you as it work for me.
